byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Ankara, Turkey, and Moushira Jammal from Gaza City.

abstract: Israel, as part of deal resuming diplomatic relations with Turkey, agrees to pay $20 million to families of Turkish activists killed during 2010 raid on ship bound for Gaza; critics are upset because deal did not include return of bodies of two Israeli soldiers.
lead_paragraph: Israel will pay $20 million to families of activists killed during an Israeli raid and will allow aid to enter Gaza, but the bodies of two Israeli soldiers will not be returned.

headline.main: Diplomatic Deal With Turkey Upsets Israelis Wary of Conceding Too Much
headline.print_headline: A Diplomatic Deal With Turkey Upsets Israelis Wary of Conceding Too Much

snippet: Israel will pay $20 million to families of activists killed during an Israeli raid and will allow aid to enter Gaza, but the bodies of two Israeli soldiers will not be returned.
